item.title: Bases De Datos Metabolismo
item.description: Las bases de datos aca listadas son aquellas que estan relacionadas con la reconstrucción de modelos metabólicos a escala genómica, no se tienen en cuenta bases de datos como KEGG o MEtacyc. Metabolic Atlas https://metabolicatlas.org/about Metabolic Atlas is a freely available resource containing detailed information about a set of open-source GEMs, specifically Human1 and Yeast8. These are two reference models containing all possible reactions that could occur in human, and yeast, respectively.

About us The Bioinformatics and Systems Biology group (GiBBS) is physically located at National University of Colombia in Bogotá, Colombia (South America). Our research is focused on the reconstruction and analysis of biological networks into three main areas: Computational Modeling, Machine Learning in Biological Systems and Statistical Genomics. Research areas Computational Modeling Coordinated by professor Andrés Pinzón Ph.D. Institute for Genetics, National University of Colombia. Biologist specialized in the application and development of Systems biology and Bioinformatics methos for the study of biological networks.
Contact Carrera 45 N° 26-85 -Institute for Genetics. Phone: +57 1 316 5000 Ext. 11618 (office), 11630 (Laboratory) Email: ampinzonv@unal.edu.co

GiBBS Computational Laboratory GiBBS computational laboratory is located at Institute for Genetics (IGUN), National University of Colombia (UN). Our lab consists of various desktop machines, an intermediate capacity server (100GB RAM, 27 CPU cores) and a hyper convergent DELL VRTX cluster solution with the following overall characteristics: Four power Edge M640 blade servers. RAM: 2.8 TB Storage: 120 TB 280 CPU cores Xeon Gold 2.6 GhZ Deep level cluster configuration is supported by engineer Javier Duque.

Publications Daniel Osorio, Andrés Pinzón, Cynthia Martín-Jiménez, George E. Barreto4 and Janneth González. Multiple Pathways Involved in Palmitic Acid-Induced Toxicity: A System Biology Approach. Front. Neurosci., 2020. doi.org/10.3389/fnins.2019.01410 Kelly Botero, Silvia Restrepo and Andres Pinzon. A genome-scale metabolic model of potato late blight suggests a photosynthesis suppression mechanism. BMC Genomics 2018, 19(Suppl8):863. 2018. Pinzon W, Vega H, Gonzalez J and Pinzon A. Mathematical Framework Behind the Reconstruction and Analysis of Genome Scale Metabolic Models.

Teaching The following courses are instructed by GiBBS active members: Bioinformatics for Omic Science by Andrés Pinzón (2027081) . Systems Biology of Metabolism by Andrés Pinzón (2026806). Statistical Genomics by Liliana López. Introduction to Machine Learning by Juan D. García.
